Reviews.Title: “CENTRAL AFFORDABLE & STUNNING VIEWS”
Reviews.Author: ellafj
Reviews.Content: Refurbished with good quality carpets & fittings, spacious rooms. Do visit the 25th floor cocktail bar & restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: muscateer1
Reviews.Content: Great location, big rooms, comfortable bed, bathroom neat and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Armouree
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely, we had a view of Sydney Harbour and it was phenomenal! The room and bathroom was beauitful and parking was plentiful and reasonably priced. It's a great location, just between the city and kings cross. The staff were friendly and professional and gave good advice on restaurants, etc. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Well priced central Sydney hotel”
Reviews.Author: talya
Reviews.Content: This was the first time I stayed solo in a hotel. I was a little nervous. However on arrival, late at night, the hotel staff were friendly and I relaxed straight away. The room was spacious and clean. The view from my room was lovely. A distant view of the harbour and bridge. This hotel is not new and has a bit of a tired feel. However, I was satisfied as thought it was was great value for money. I stayed three nights and slept well. I was next to the lift and was worried it might be noisy but found it very quiet. The location is fantastic if you want to be near the cbd.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: daleandjanet
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, it's located between kings cross and the city. A little walk from the harbour but well priced

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel for small family”
Reviews.Author: paulandlisaplus2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in March for a family holiday, 2 adults and 2 kids, a 2 and 4 year old. We stayed in a twin room which had two double beds, although we did not have a view of the harbour, view from room was still nice. Hotel was clean, and buffet breakfast included in our package was good. We had dinner on the 25th floor restaurant with great views of harbour. Location of hotel was good, about 10 minutes walk to cbd. Although being right in cbd would be easier. Bus stop just out front to go to circular quay. Europcar car hire was just next door which made picking up hire car easy. Hotel doers not have pool, which didnt affect us. Noise in hotel room was ok for general street noise, but could here sirens etc. overall a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bayview Boulevard several times now and always stay there when in Sydney. It was the busy Mardi Gras weekend and we arrived early on the Saturday morning. Our room wasn't ready, we were tired and it was raining so we decided to wait in reception for our room. Whilst there numerous other people checked in and went off exploring as their rooms weren't ready either. After about an hour the guy on concierge came over and asked us our names again. He then radioed housekeeping and asked them to clean our room next as he had already taken our luggage up to our room. We could not have been happier and were in our room within 20 minutes and much sooner than the advertised 2pm check in time. We prefer a harbour view room and we were not disappointed with the great view. I'd say that this hotel is 3.5 to 4 stars and the rooms are of good quality. They are nice and quiet and everything works well. I had room service one night and the service was quick and the food of good quality. As others have mentioned the location is excellent. The only negative I can see is the quality of the bathroom towels. They are very thin and old and it's time they upgraded them. We will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect City Location”
Reviews.Author: chrisvandermerwe
Reviews.Content: Location is best. Walking distance from the major attractions. Oxford Street, Pit Street, The Rocks, Darling Harbor and King Street are all within walking distance. Many restaurants less than 5 minutes walk from the hotel with the Strand Hotel pub right across the street. The Hop on Hop Off Bus tours stop right in front of the hotel for both the City and Bondi tours. Less than 20 minutes from the airport with a taxi while the closest train station is a short walk away for a quick ride to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty average for a 'nice' hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leccy_26_
Reviews.Content: Apart from great location and clean room, I wouldn't recommend this hotel. The staff at the front desk were ALL rude apart from one younger French man who was treated appallingly by other staff (looks so unprofessional!). To top if off I noticed we were overcharged on check in (and only noticed on check out) which then of course delayed our check out and we were handballed to the manager who in the end, did refund the money to my credit card. We stayed for 5 nights and on one afternoon we say a homeless person sleeping in the foyer on one of the couches.... not sure how long they were there for but surely a staff member noticed?! We still had a great Mardi Gras in Sydney, but next time we head down for the event, we're not staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and view”
Reviews.Author: seattlelovesparis
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed here for a girl's weekend. Neither of us had visited Sydney before and found the location perfect for walking to all the important sites such as the botanical gardens, shopping, mueseums, bridge, waterfront and the Opera House. We took a taxi ($10.00) back from the waterfront the first night as we had walked across the Harbor Bridge earlier and were tired. The walk from the waterfront to the hotel is only about 20 minutes and in a very safe area. We had a view of "The Domain" park and the harbor and a peek-a-boo view of the top of the Opera House from our fifth floor room. Ask for a higher floor and I am sure the view would be even better and would include the Opera House. The staff was courteous and friendly although the young man working the night shift sent us to the local grocery when we ask where we could get some "cakes or sweets". He failed to mention that room service has a great selection of treats available such as fudge cake and creme brÃ»lÃ©e. The only drawback was the "towel situation". The hotel provides you 1 bath towel for each adult guest. If you would like additional towels the hotel is happy to provide them for $5.00 a towel! We found 2 towels in our room one for each of us. One towel was a nice thick towel and the other was a sad thin towel that should had been sent to the towel cemetery long ago! The next day it was the same, one good towel and one old thin towel. I would be happy to stay here again but next time, I will pack my own towels.

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: webb0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is reasonably priced when compared to others in the city and while the rooms and hotel generally is a bit tired the place is clean and functional. The restaurant and bar on the top level lack atmosphere and has a cold feel about it. On the plus side its ideally located with a nice 25-30 min stroll to either the city, Darling harbour, or the Opera house through the outstanding botanical gardens. A 10min walk up the hill brings you to vibrent Kings Cross and the underground. We paid for a room overlooking the harbour and as we were on the 6th floor it just about delivered with an obstructed view of the bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: valethatch
Reviews.Content: Top value, super views, easy to get around to all major sites especially the opera house area via the amazing botanical gardens and the beautiful harbour side walk along Fleet Steps. Around hotel many food options. Hotel staff were some of the best encounter in 40 years of international travel. Well done and looking forward to our return in two weeks ahead of flight home

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: Hollbez
Reviews.Content: We had a Deluxe Room at the Baview and it was everything we were promised. Beautiful room overlooking the Bay, Siydney Harbour Bridge and Opera House. We just wished we could have stayed longer. The room was lovely and clean and a Queen bed. Loved it. The Hotel staff were very, very helpful. Lobby very cheerful with a coffee Bar in one corner that do lovely snacks and plenty of seating area to relax. The Hotel is near to Hyde park and Kings Cross but not too near the Harbours but it is in a walkable distance. There are Hop On and Hop Off buses that tour the City and a bus stop right outside the Hotel. Well worth getting a 24 hr ticket.

Reviews.Title: “Stay over New Years”
Reviews.Author: dmdriedi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Dec31-Jan5. It was the only hotel we could find that did not charge triple for New Years. It is a nice hotel but the bed was a bit hard. Staff were very helpful and we got a good rate on internet instead of paying by the day. I wish all hotels offered free wifi in this day and age is should be standard but that's another subject. This place is close to the museum and Kings Cross but I really didn't like that area very much. The room was clean and I had no complaints. Standard hotel, no frills but no real complaints. We watched New Years fireworks from the 25th floor. It worked out for us not having to go through the crowds to see the fireworks but tickets were $250 and we only received appies and champagne. The appies were ok but we waited forever to get any and when they came there were usually not enough to go around our table. But even still, the fact we didn't have to fight the crowd made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, excellent location, great staff & stunning views!”
Reviews.Author: TexShelli
Reviews.Content: My first visit to Sydney was enhanced by staying at Bayview Boulevard. The hotel is nice with a great location right by Hyde Park and Kings Cross so food, entertainment and shopping are all very convenient. Sydney is very walkable so you can easily access the tourist sites, tours, the harbor, opera house, etc. by walking or using the Hop On Hop Off tour bus that picks up right out in front of the hotel. The hotel restaurant offers a good breakfast...pricey but good food and an easy way to fuel up before heading out for long walks and sightseeing. I appreciated the on site laundry, helpful and attentive staff and the location. The hotel is clean and in a safe location. The only downside was no free wifi but I would stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “"Great stay"”
Reviews.Author: Susan H
Reviews.Content: Great location rooms were very spacious and clean. we were given a free upgrade and had a harbour view which was an added bonus. cannot comment on the service as we didnt use any of the resturants and bars they closed due to public holiday so that was a down side but on the up side plenty of restaurants, cafes, bars within easy walking distance. Darling Harbour lovely setting for a evening meal.

Reviews.Title: “nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Vuthinands
Reviews.Content: its a good clean and decent hotel. very good location. the staffs are excellent. rooms are very very spacious. Value for money i would recommend to everyone. The wifi was not that important. The factor that it was clean that makes me like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful stay”
Reviews.Author: AusverGeorge
Reviews.Content: Great location and good value for money were the key to decide to stay in this hotel but we were pleasantly surprised by the view from the windows and the comfort in general of the room we had. Breakfast included was only continental, so it felt a bit not enough but service was fine though could improve a tad more. Parking overnight is just A$25 and I strongly suggest everybody to go for it if needed. We parked on a side street and deeply regreted as our car we broken in. But that problem had nothing to do with the hotel, where we had a beautiful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in Sydney with great views”
Reviews.Author: James1London
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 10 mins walking distance of the City Centre and the views from the bedrooms across to the Sydney Harbour and also the Botanical Gardens were excellent. The room price was good compared with other Sydney hotels and the staff were extremely helpful and polite. We stayed at the hotel for 10 days leading up to Christmas with a room on the 18th floor and awoke evey morning to a view of the harbour which was stunning. The room was also very quiet and large, with a king size bed and a nice bathroom.The restaurant situated on the 25th floor gave wonderful views of Sydney at night, and the food was excellent too, and not expensive. The hotel also has a small gym and a sauna suite on the 24th floor. Highly recommended for both holiday and business accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, ordinary, no wifi in room”
Reviews.Author: AlbertSolihull
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel many months ago, so that we could spend New Year's eve in Sydney. The hotel had a wide view, albeit the bay was a long way off and there was just a glimpse of a small part of the bridge. The cost over the New Year weekend was phenomenal. The room was reasonably large, but there was no wifi in the room and you had to pay to use it in the lobby. The towels in the bathroom were very skimpy, quite inadequate. The cafe on the first floor was usually empty; the breakfast was average, but expensive. The place was just lacking in interest. To be fair, the manager always tried to help where he could and staff generally were helpful. The top floor bar / restaurant had a good view, but it was closed during the day. Location was quite good, but the hotel needed improvement for us to want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Room with a View”
Reviews.Author: Colin S
Reviews.Content: There is nothing wrong with this place. It is pretty basic. What you are paying for is the view. On the higher floors facing the harbour, the view is spectacular. On the night I stayed I was able to watch a fireworks display bursting over Sydney harbour. I have to agree with some of the other reviewers, nothing else is really included for the tariff apart from the room and the view. It seems all hotels in this class (and I would call this three and a half star at best) have studied the Holiday Inn manual and got the economics of room rental down to a fine art. Still, having said that, the hotel is close to the CBD and the Botanic Gardens. The major attractions of Sydney are within walking distance. The only downside is the proximity to some of the seedier parts of town. I wouldnt recommend walking the streets surrounding the hotel after dark. The place does have an ambience of a hotel that was once great, was really let go and then has recently been "tarted up".

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: bellobabe
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Bayview last Saturday and Sunday night (3-5th December 2012). We booked a City View room with twin beds on the 19th floor, on recommendation from other Trip Advisor reviews (the higher the quieter!). The room was clean, quiet, comfortable and had everything we needed, and had two what I assume were king singles for us to sleep in. The beds were also very comfortable, slept like a baby. There were bathrobes and tea and coffee facilities provided, and a decent sized telly. The view was nice but not outstanding - if you can afford it get the Harbour View I would suggest. The shower was decent also. We were so busy we never ate at the hotel, but we ate breakfast at nearby Stanley Street two mornings running, where Bill & Tony's (a real institution) quickly serve you a mean foccacia and latte for around $12 - yummy. The location of the hotel was absolutely fantastic - we were a short walk away from a festival at the Domain we attended, and within walking distance of the Cross, Oxford Street and the city. We felt safe and secure. Would recommend to anyone and will be staying here on all future trips. Downsides... hard to think of anything. Oh... also, check in is later than normal - 3pm - but checkout is later than normal also - 11am. We arrived early (1pm) and they checked with the maids while we waited - 10 mins later we had our room, could dump our bags and go out. Fantastic. Friendly, efficient staff. I'll shut up now :)

Reviews.Title: “superb views of city, bridge and opera”
Reviews.Author: Schinu76
Reviews.Content: For our first honeymoon night we went for a splurge and picked one of the few available and affordable 5 star hotels within a few blocks from the CBD. As it wasn"t listed in either of our travel guides we chose mostly from web feedback. Location: Convenient to Museum, few blocks easily walkable from CBD, int the street with most city car rentals, quite a bit away from water Outside: unspectacular Inside: nothing special but neat Service: very nice, instant update on late checkout for honeymoon Room: executive harbourview 21st floor, very spacious room and bathroom, all very nice (standard rate apparently around 600$, our web tariff 275$ including huge breakfast buffet View: luna park, complete bridge, all of central skyline from big tower to left to bridge on right, smaller buildings in front, really nice. Window was sealed. Very recommendable for the price (probably not for the standard tariff!)

Reviews.Title: “More basic than it seems”
Reviews.Author: littleums
Reviews.Content: This hotel supports a common theme I have noticed, particularly in Australia: it is a hotel that seems rather flash, but actually offers little in the way of complimentary amenities. Basically, you pay for a room and get little else. The rooms are fine - the same you would see at any hotel in any big, international city - but they don't offer anything really unique or special. I am sure I would feel differently if I had a room with a view, so I should put it out there that I didn't have a harbour view. For me, hotels are mainly a place to relax after a long day of sightseeing, so I don't need much, and this room certainly delivered. However, I would have expected a bit more given the price (you have to pay extra for breakfast, either in your room rate or at the restaurant), and the image they seemed to want to have. Examples: - They didn't even have the basic digital free-to-air channels. Instead, they give you Fox and Fox Sports. It seemed to me that they wanted you to pay for movies, and that this was their sneaky way of doing it. That, and the fact that every time you turned on the tele it automatically went to the screen trying to sell you movies. - They advertise a fitness centre, which I used, but which I was very disappointed in. The treadmills were broken for the duration of the stay, and the other equipment was pretty average. The dumbbells only went up to 7 kg! I am a 50 kg female, and that's not even enough for me to bicep curls with, let alone exercises like squats, etc. Not sure what a larger person would think... I know these are fairly minor complaints, but my point is just that this is one of those hotels that provides nothing for free. Your room rate will pay for a place to stay and not much else. if you have a deluxe room, then you will have access to a fitness 'centre', but don't expect a great workout. I would stay here again if I found another deal, but I wouldn't pay full price for the rooms. The location of this hotel is excellent, and security is excellent as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view on the 18th floor”
Reviews.Author: jacarandas
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I was there for on Saturday night, over the weekend when the Sydney Marathon was held. The room we were given was on the 18th floor. The room was of a decent size and comes with a King Size bed. Surprisingly, we actually managed to check in much earlier than the normal check in time. We were told to state our preferred check in time on the form when we booked online, but didn't think the hotel was going to allow us to check in early anyway. So, that was lovely. The room had excellent views, and we actually managed to catch some fireworks going off in a distance on Saturday night. That was a pleasant surprise! :)

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca G
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed Friday, Saturday and Sunday nights. We didn't close our curtain for the entire time - it was too wonderful to wake up to such a view! From our room (we had a Harbour View Room) we looked down at the sparkling harbour, the pearly curves of the Opera House and that unmistakable bridge. I have been to Sydney before but it was years ago so I didn't know my way around very well. All I had to do was look out the window and I could plot my route for the day. We walked into The Rocks and past (and into!) all the great shops along George Street, doing an easy and spectacular loop through the Botanical Gardens. The hotel was an easy walking distance to everything we wanted to do. The staff were helpful and friendly, even at 4.45am in the morning when we had to leave to catch a flight. We ordered room service twice and the food was good value and came within 20minutes. We did have a small problem with the lock on our door but it was fixed quickly. All in all, it was a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel .. With a great location!”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiBoo
Reviews.Content: I love the location of this hotel. You can walk to all the major great must see spots from here. The Rocks, Oxford Street, kings Cross and Surry Hill and much more! Staff are nice and the rooms are very roomie. Nice Pub across the street.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Blue Mountains, New South Wales, Australia
Reviews.Title: “Lovely views and a lovely hotel with some disappointments”
Reviews.Author: RandJ73
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed on the Monday Long weekend. The reservations manager on the phone was very pleasant. Some disapointment both The restaurant and The Cafe shut on the Monday night for the long weekend. Staff were certainly not rude but didn't really go out of their way. The room allocated to us was lovely, an Emerald Harbour view suite on level 24 but really was an interconnecting room with some lounge chairs in the other room. Breakfast provided had the usual choices and was cooked nicely. (Bacon and snags not at all greasy). What was disappointing and surprising the executive lounge was taken from the Public and used for Airline Crew. Very noticable considering there was nowhere else in the motel to get a coffee or a drink. I am not sure if staff could recommend an alternative venue. (not given many alternatives and maybe some training in this area would benefit). Would certainly recommend maybe I had different expectations...I imagine this would have been the place to be in the days of Graham Kennedy, Donny Sutherland and the like!!

Reviews.Title: “Usually good value”
Reviews.Author: mrdom
Reviews.Content: I often stay here as you can get nice harbour view rooms relatively cheaply, although I've noticed that the specials are much rarer now. The low prices are at the expense of service however. It's not terrible but generally distant and, more importantly, extremely slow. Their computer system must be terrible. Checking in and out takes forever as does any simple query.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay - Amazing Views - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: John D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayview last week end for two nights and our stay was amazing. We live in Western Sydney but we are pretty familiar with the City. We normally stay in the CBD, but this time, we wanted to try something different, and having a wedding party in the Eastern suburbs, bayview hotel was the perfect choice. We arrived just before the sunset on the friday, and the hotel was the perfect romantic gateway for us. We stayed in a Deluxe room facing the harbour. We were quite impressed with the romantic atmosphere and the view of the harbour. We wanted to have a bite in the CBD, but the front office staff suggested us to go to the restaurant located on the 25th floor, and I was very happy with my choice. Prices are reasonable if you consider the the darkish and relaxed atmosphere, facing the harbour bridge and the city skyline. Food is good and staff is very friendly. We had a lazy morning and did not have breakfasts the following day as we had to get ready for the wedding party on Saturday. We ask to order a taxi, and the reception mentioned that there are plenty cabs available in the street next to the hotel, so it was not a problem to find one straight away. When we came back from the party in the middle of the night, a security guard checked our IDs and politely let us in. Bayview hotel is a great value if you want to escape, and much cheaper than 5* hotels in the CBD. We will definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value”
Reviews.Author: By_Cy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this property on two occassions, once in town for a friend's birthday and another for new year's celebrations. I've got to say, both times have been consistently impressive. The hotel itself is neat and presentable, and the rooms are well appointed. It's not spectacular, but for the price, it's good value. The lifts are a bit tricky, but I guess it's to keep unwanted guests from using the hotel (it IS 5 mins from Kings Cross, after all). If you're travelling from the station, catch a cab because the walk is a hike (especially if you have bags with you). Otherwise, it's close to various late night kebab and takeaway places. Definitely a good choice if you're working/playing towards that end of Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: craig s
Reviews.Content: Would never have expected the hotel to illegally use my credit card details after I had checked out. After constant following-up with the hotel after I checked out they explained to me that it was an oversight on their part. It took a further two weeks to resolve the situation and for the hotel to refund the huge debit on my card and this is after constant harassment. In the meantime my credit card was cancelled, I had no credit card facility when I was abroad, all costs to resolve the issue was borne by me and all the hotel manager could say was sorry. My advice to you if you considering this hotel is to stay away as they have no concept of customer service. Furthermore there is no wifi internet access in room and internet fees are a complete rip-off. Craig S

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay and great value”
Reviews.Author: mv18829
Reviews.Content: Am normally used to staying more towards the CBD when staying in Sydney. Took a punt and chose this place for three nights with the family and was very pleased with our decision. First the hotel was very easy to get to, as it's almost straight out of the exit from the Eastern Distributor so less than 20 mins to/from the airport. It's near Hyde Park and as such away from the main hustle of the CBD, but really less than 10 mins walk to the CBD. We opted for a room with two queen beds, which cost us around $180/night and I think was one of the best value rooms we've stayed in recent times. The reception staff and concierge were very helpful and friendly. The rooms were very modern and spacious with a great view. The bathroom was clean and spacious with a great shower and bath. The beds were very comfortable and the AC worked well. The hotel has a small gym and steam room etc but no pool. We attempted room service for dinner one night and were very pleased with the offering and timely service. Thoroughly recommend this place and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: inkypete
Reviews.Content: Recently started staying at the Bayview Boulevard on my business trips to Sydney. This is an excellent mid range hotel. The rooms have all the features you need and great views of Sydney city and harbour if you get a room on that side. Nice beds, good showers, excellent staff, good size rooms. The location is handy too - half way between Sydney centre and kings Cross. Probably a 10 minute walk to city but the hill can be a killer. William Street is busy so easy to get a cab, plenty of people around and a few good eating places nearby. The cafe in the hotel is very good for quick snacks, great coffee and good value. I haven't eaten on the 25th floor as yet but I am told it is very good too. Breakfast is typical hotel buffet plus you can have a fresh made espresso latte etc - most hotels charge more for that. Even had a second. I would like to see a hotel like this include wifi free like most overseas hotels but this isn't quite the aussie thing as yet. Over all this is a very good hotel, run by cheerful and attentive staff at a very good price for Sydney CBD. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay”
Reviews.Author: NVDeeJay
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a nice place to stay for our last night in Sydney...did some research, and any 4 or 5 star hotel in the city was starting at $350+ a night!!?! After due diligence, found a price of $162 a night and quickly gobbled up 3 rooms for my family. Needless to say, the room was clean and spacious. Location was convenient and a short walking distance from the city centre, Darling Harbour, etc. and it far exceeded my expectations...especially after reading the bad reviews?!? Front desk staff was very courteous and helpful. I would definitely recommend Bayview Boulevard to anybody staying in Sydney! Thanks for helping us enjoy our last night in Sydney!

Reviews.Title: “Good stay”
Reviews.Author: WenZan
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews I was a bit unsure however it turned out to be a really good hotel. The staff were pleasant and efficient. The room was clean, it was on the 5th floor overlooking the busy street, I could hear sirens but wasn't woken up at night at all. It was easy to get to in the car & parking was relatively easy & cheap. It was in walking distance to everywhere in the city & the Domain was easy to get to for a run. I'll stay here for business again. We (work colleagues) went to the restaurant on the top floor for dinner on Friday night and the service was good and the food excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A great base in Sydney”
Reviews.Author: valmae
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Bayview Boulevard numerous times now. It was fully refurbed around five or six years ago and the rooms are still in good condition. We normally stay in a deluxe city or harbour view room and this stay we went for the harbour view room. The lower grade rooms (standard) are lower in the building aren't quite as nice. My advice is deluxe and why not go for the harbour view - it's well worth the extra. We have once had a room in the top grade which is Emerald. The room was nicer again and ours had a spa bath in the bathroom. We have always found the staff the be helpful and friendly. The rooms are quiet and comfortable and have extra pillows if you need them. There is cable TV in the room and the air conditioning works well. We have had breakfast at the hotel but with Sydney at your door we'd rather eat out. Location wise you are within easy walking distance to the CBD, Kings Cross/Potts Point and Wooloomooloo with all of their cafes and restaurants. Darlinghurst is just one block away and there are numerous great places to eat there. The only negative I could see was the quality of the bathroom towels which are a little thin for a four star property. Free hotel wifi has not really taken off yet in Australia so yes they do charge here. We have booked to go back next month.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: shouen
Reviews.Content: My family of 2 adults and 2 children stayed for 8 nights in a Deluxe room with 2 double beds. After reading the poor reviews here, I was apprehensive that I may have made a wrong choice. To my surprise, our stay here was way above satisfactory and I have absolutely no complaints whatsoever. We arrived very early, about 8am and already, our room was ready for us, several hours before check-in time. Front Desk staff was prompt and polite and check-in was smooth and quick. The room was spacious and clean. More than enough space for the 4 of us and all our luggage. It had all the amenities of a 4-star hotel. Bathroom was clean and extra towels were provided even without having to request. Breakfast was standard fare and again, both food and service met our expectations. No complaints with the location either. While I wouldn't consider it in the "centre" of town, it was still well within walking distance to places like Circular Quay, The Rocks and Darling Harbour. Even with 2 children, it only took us between 15 to 25 minutes to get to the main attractions by foot. I have to say that I was surprised at how pleasant our stay was at this hotel, especially after reading all the negative reviews. I think if you are looking for a luxury hotel, or if you desire something "fancy", perhaps the Bayview Boulevard isn't for you. However, if you are the type that would be happy in a good 4-star hotel, you probably won't be disappointed. All in all, we had a good experience and wouldn't hesitate in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “ABOVE and Beyond BAD Customer Service !”
Reviews.Author: greenerie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there from 6-8 May 2011. Upon return to Melbourne, I got greeted by 2 bills for a bottle of wine ($30) and movie charge ($16.95) -- both of which we did not consume. I called on 18 May to dispute the bill. A duty manager called me today and said he would reverse the charge for the wine, and INSISTED that I watched 2 movies instead of one, hence this extra bill! During my checkout at the hotel on 8 May, we went through this same motion with the lady who checked us out, and agreed to bill us one instead of two movies. We had a change of room because the first room's movie did not work, and the 2nd room did not work and we left the room for dinner. And after dinner we came back and found that the movie system was working, we then watched a movie and paid for it. I asked the duty manager today could it be that the movie started playing after we left the room for dinner. He had the cheek to lecture me I SHOULD have turned off the TV before I left. He insisted that the system recorded a longer time of the movie that would justify 2 movies instead of one. I told him I am not going to pay for the system's fault as the movie was not working in the new room when for dinner. In fact the very system stuffed us up, such that we have to switch rooms! We even gave a feedback to the duty manager that day as we left the lobby that the room's movie was not working either. The worst customer experience ever is today's phone call. I had a duty manager who was rude and determined to quarrel with me on the phone. He was extremely argumentative and refused to listen. While I was talking and explaining, he was talking too, in fact he raised his voice at me. I reminded him I am the customer and he was not listening, and I would complain to his management. He told me to "go ahead". AND, I did. Why as a customer do I have to feel being prosecuted ? Instead of pacifying me, I left call extremely disappointed and furious. If the hotel made the mistake of mischarging me for wine that I did not consume, promised us a room with a working movie system but only to not work when we checked in, accused me of watching something I did not, how can we trust this is a fair call? Look, I have flown my husband in for a birthday weekend in Sydney, packed with surprises and little adventures. Did you really think I am that dodgy to want to avoid paying $16.95??? I am addressing the bigger issue here. Whoever that is going to respond to me here, please think twice before you defend company staff. I have never been triggered to this far to want to write a complaint. I suggest you investigate this with your management and highlight some serious customer service issues at stake. And don't bother telling me you look forward to my next stay, even if you pay me, I would not risk it!!

Reviews.Title: “A good but at the same time unpleasant experience!”
Reviews.Author: alyssa2442
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Bayview Boulevard in early April and upon arrival was very happy with everything. I found it strange that the underneath of my car was checked in the car park and that my car boot was opened - although no one else's was. My room was lovely (Standard city side room) yet for extra towels it was an additional $5, which I thought was ridiculous! There isn't enough light in the room, which is a downfall. Room service was fairly priced. Ringing reception asking for the closest pizza shop was unsuccessful as they had no idea. Upon returning to my room after a night out to celebrate my birthday a horrible big Indian man on concierge would not allow my friends to collect their items from my room. He made out to the manager that I was promiscuous bringing a male back to my room - who was my boyfriend! He told the manager I had a huge group of people in the room and that he would call the police. I was very disappointed in how my friends were treated and how he judged me! I would recommend this hotel but I hope the man gets fired as I was very upset on my Birthday!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Mungbeans11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for four days in November last year. This hotel is quite average. Although clean, the room felt quite tired and the decor rather dated. The hotel restaurant has a lovely view and we were quite impressed with the food. Room service was prompt and polite. We found the attitude of staff hovered somewhere between indifferent to perplexing. If you want a staff member to help with the door or flag a taxi you need to see the Concierge near the side entrance. If you use the front door you are on your own. On one occasion I arrived back at the hotel with a colleague. We got in the lift, busy talking and had our hands full with our laptop cases, and so did not immediately have our passes available to select our floor number. A senior staff member came in and swiped his so we took this opportunity to select our floor numbers. He then demanded of us that we produce our key passes! Bare in mind we are middle aged, respectable looking business women. This is quite possibly the strangest interaction I have ever had with hotel staff. Although I wouldn't avoid the hotel if there wasn't another alternative, I won't be going out of my way to stay there again either.

Reviews.Title: “Still good Value”
Reviews.Author: WizardMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Its been a year since my last visit to this hotel and it is still good value for money "if you get the right rate". Great position, good size room, comfortable bed, friendly staff Only small complaint is the time it took to check in, nearly 20 minutes with just 2 staff behind the desk, by the time a third person appeared the line had diminished. Check out fast and easy. Not the newest hotel around, but for a central position in Sydney and value for money, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent location if you want to tour the city on foot.”
Reviews.Author: Superplus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a very good position for touring the city on foot as it is only a short walk down to the Botanic Gardens and then the Opera House etc.. The reception staff were very welcoming and helpful. The room was spacious and the bathroom was great. Unfortunately the fire alarm went off at about 3.15 in the morning so the majority of the residents went down in their pyjamas to the street. We were told that it appeared there was a fault but the hotel staff could not let us back in until the fire brigade had confirmed this. It was no problem as it was quite pleasant standing on the street in pj's when it was a little cooler. When we were allowed back in it was a mad dive for the lifts. When I woke the next morning there was a letter under the door from the management apologising. Lovely hotel, lovely location, lovely staff.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Anna187
Reviews.Content: We booked a twin room 7 months (!) in advance for January 2011.Upon verifying in December 2010 if the booking was still confirmed, we got an email from the Bayview Boulevard hotel, that the twinroom could not be guaranteed unless we paid 30 A$ per night extra!! If booking a twinroom and the hotel cannot provide one, then they should just inform you. Good that we verified. The hotel did not mention this at the time of booking, probably they wanted to 'surprise' us with this upon arrival. It needs no explanation that we cancelled the booking immediately. So beware of hidden extra costs at the Bayview Boulevard!!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: travelbugbitten10
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the recommendation of family and the profile of previous guests but I expected more than what I got. It was a bit tired, room was smallish and bathroom nothing special. For the cost, it was certainly overrated. The next night was spent in a hotel that was twice as nice for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Tidy well placed reasonably priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: lamethley
Reviews.Content: Not too far to walk to circular key, opera house etc and well placed for action of Kings Cross. Has underground car park which is not cheap but is convenient. Go for a harbour view room on the higher floors. Comfortable, spacious, quiet rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, definitely recommend!”
Reviews.Author: CheshireHappybride
Reviews.Content: Great location, slightly out of the main hotel / business district, but great to energise yourself with a walk through the parks in a morning. Our city view room had 2 comfortable double beds, and was really spacious, with lots of storage. Great shower in the bathroom. Air-conditioning was good. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel, but did eat in the 25th floor restaurant one evening. Amazing views over the harbour bridge and opera house, amazing food, amazing service.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: gusBeith
Reviews.Content: On world tour. Arrived to find that our room did not have a view of the Bay. This was rectified when we complained. Arranged to have a special dinner on the 25th floor restaurant. Booked the table earlier in the day. Arrived at the dinning area. Shown to our table. No one came to welcome us or offer us a drink. 25 minutes later after we complained about the service the waitress said she would privide a menue. Nothing happened. 15 minutes later we complained vigerously about the service and left after having sat at a table for over 40 minutes. Went down stairs to complain to the manager who didn't appear to take our complaint very seriously. No feed back from the manager. At the end of our 3 day stay we once again outlined our problems to the manager by letter. No further action received. Having stayed in so many different hotels in Canada, San Francisco, Auckland , Queenstown, Melbourne and Hong Kong. this is the worst hotel by far.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: drk65
Reviews.Content: Positives- geographical position, staff Negatives-the phone in my room is terrible and does not work, the key card is temperamental, the lifts are not air conditioned and take for ever, the gym is not a gym ( a token gym), room service took 1 hour to deliver a bucket of ice....

Reviews.Title: “Wheelchair accessible but not user friendly!!”
Reviews.Author: Neeeeeeeena
Reviews.Content: Having done a lot of research to find a value for money hotel, close to the city which was wheelchair accessible, we decided on this one for the weekend. The room was accessible but not at all user friendly. The bed was too low and on wheels so moved when my fiance was trying to get on and off it. The toilet was too high so unusable with a shower chair. The bed was hard and uncomfortable and so were the pillows. WORST 2 nights sleep ever!!!! Also don't know what was so "DELUXE" about the deluxe room??! Internet is $25 a day which if it were free would have made our stay that little bit better. The 25th floor restaurant has great views and the staff were lovely although the food was average.

Reviews.Title: “Basic 3 star accommodation, misleading 'deluxe' rooms”
Reviews.Author: kj_4444
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Bayview Boulevard, and having researched quite thoroughly to find a good value hotel with the facilities and location we wanted, we were eagerly awaiting our visit. We had booked a Great Escape package, and were definitely looking forward to our Deluxe rooms with a Harbour view. There was a harbour view, and that was great. However, the rest of the room and hotel left much to be desired. I have travelled through much of Europe, and this was definitely a 3 star tourist class hotel, NOT 4 star as advertised. The 'King' sized bed was two (EXTREMELY) hard singles pushed together. The pillows were also quite closely related to bricks, which all in all made for two very uncomfortable nights! The room was a little cramped due to the unnecessary cot bed that was between the â€˜kingâ€™ bed and two chairs/window. The bathroom was quite dated, with no exhaust fan which wasnâ€™t ideal, seeing as there was no window in the bathroom. This meant in order to have a shower and not pass out from the steam, the bathroom door needed to be left open while showering. Also not great as the toilet was in the bathroom as well. Enough said. The shower head was new and had good water pressure etc, but was too low down for male guests, my partner is just under 6foot and he had to duck to wash his hair which wasnâ€™t too convenient. The rooms were quiet other than the last night when some drunken guests came home at 3am, which is not the hotel's fault though. The service we received from the staff varied, some were lovely (the concierges were great), while some breakfast staff didn't seem to speak much English and would run away when you tried to get their attention (they wouldnâ€™t allow us to get more tea and coffee for ourselves so we had reason to try and get their attention). The breakfast was one high note, it was of good quality and quantity, but the staff wouldnâ€™t let you pick the table you wished to dine at which was odd. To elaborate on the standard of service, of particular note was on our first night when we were looking for some restaurants in the nearby area. There was no one at the conciergeâ€™s desk, so we asked Paulina at reception were we should go. Her look of disdain as she told us that â€˜there are restaurants everywhereâ€™ and gestured vaguely off to her right, was supremely unhelpful and downright rude. All in all, I wouldnâ€™t recommend this hotel unless it has some specific quality that you are looking for, like its location between Kings Cross and the city itself for example, which wasnâ€™t a necessity for us. It was without doubt a letdown to our overall trip to Sydney, and I wish we had booked another hotel in the city that actually lived up to its 4 star rating!

Reviews.Title: “For the business traveller”
Reviews.Author: Pablo_M
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, good location. Clean, quiet and comfortable room. Professional, efficient staff. Quick check in and quick check out. Certainly oriented towards the business traveller. Whilst it has some good business facilities overall as a tourist class hotel I would rate it three stars as it is basic accommodation. This is an old hotel and even though they've made a good attempt at keeping it modern through renovation it still feels dated. If you're after good value and a decent nights sleep then this hotel is recommended.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT CONFERENCE AND ACCOMODATION PACKAGES”
Reviews.Author: tanya072
Reviews.Content: myself and my colleagues stayed and conferenced at the bayview boulevard. For our first time, i must say that the service and the organisation of the conference and events team was second to none!!!!! Our accommodation rooms were not bad at all, with amazing views of sydney harbour. I highly reccomend this hotel for their conference and accommodation facilities, location and value for money. I will be passing on this feedback to our senior management for them to rebook this hotel for future events.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: AussiePaulw
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the BB hotel for our wedding aniversary and was a little worried as we had not heard much about this place. The Hotel itself is well located and on arrival we were impressed as we were greated at the the car park entrance by an attendant who asked me to open our boot for inspection as he was checking the underside of our car. This was no inconvience and we were pleased with the security measures they took. On arrival in the well layed out Lobby we were greated by a friendly recptionist who informed us that our room was availabe now despite our arrival of only 11am. Our room on the 14th floor was well presented with all facilities that we needed and a fantastic view of Sydney Harbour and the harbour bridge. Having time to kill before our show later that night we walked from the hotel and was in the CBD in no more than 15 minutes. In the afternoon when we arrived back we decided that we would have some Dinner before the show and managed to get a early table at the Seasons restaurant on the 25th floor. The view from this point was excellent as we sat at our window seat. The menu selection offered a variety of choices that were reasonably priced and service and quality was excellent. Overall I would defiently stay here again as we found the whole weekend a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “clean, great value, good breakfast and complimentary parking - perfect for what we needed”
Reviews.Author: bigmamma73
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel lastminute and were pleasantly surprised at the quality and value for money, especially having travelled from the UK and having found Aus quite expensive. Two double beds, clean bathroom with all we needed for our family of 2 adults and two children aged 2 and 5. A large buffet breakfast was included as well as secure parking, all for $210, booked through Lastminute. We even discovered that we had booked the wrong date and there was no hassle to change. A little way out of town for little legs but the bus stop was right outside and little italy is just over the road for evening meals. Good service aswell. Thankyou.

Reviews.Title: “A great find - good value”
Reviews.Author: Lindylou55
Reviews.Content: We had an Emerald room which was actually a suite complete with 2 bathrooms, 2 TVs 2 minibars. The view was great with closeup of St Mary's Cathedral, Opera house and Bridge in the distance. These rooms are at back of hotel so no street noise from William Street. The whole hotel was the cleanest we have seen in Sydney. Valet parking was prompt and the Counter staff friendly. The rate included parking and breakfast so for a suite with a view of the harbour it was great value. Easy access to Bridge and Kings Cross. Loads of transport at the door. Hyde Park a stroll down the road. Their 25th floor bar was a little disappointing however you have a million bars in the Cross to choose from We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but needs to improve on customer service”
Reviews.Author: Bitola123
Reviews.Content: The place is pretty cheap and in a very good location. However, I'd say that 4 stars is a stretch. Non-smoking rooms smelled like smoke and the walls are thin. TVs are really old and rooms are not top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, great staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Number03
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights here and enjoyed the comfort, accessibility and breakfast. Rooms were clean, spacious and beds comfortable. Fabulous views.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: Dan_Of_Surry_Hills
Reviews.Content: Very good location for the price, easy to go to all other directions. Rooms were clean and with good view. Service was OK. For breakfast, we went to a cafe named Safira Verde On Crown just behind the hotel (recommended by a hotel's guest we met at the lobby) where we had excellent big breakfast with freshly pressed fruit juice, scrambled eggs, marvelous muesli, pancakes and truly good coffee and free fast wireless internet. Much cheaper than breakfast at the hotel and the service there was also more friendly. Anyway, the hotel does offer good value and good location. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best views in town!”
Reviews.Author: raywel
Reviews.Content: We got off to a bad start as the room wasn't ready on time and we had to wait more than an hour to get in, and then the coats we had sent up with our bags weren't there and it took another hour to find them (housekeeping had removed them). But after that, it was all class. The view of the Botanic Gardens, Opera House and the harbour from our room was absolutely stunning. We ordered room service and got takeaway food to eat in the room for the whole weekend just so we could soak up the view. Breakfast buffet was pretty good, as well.

Reviews.Title: “You can't go past this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JSMarshall15
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable accommodation with excellent facilities on the doorstep of the city. Excellent concierge service which ensured any problems were sorted very quickly. Multiple transport options - Sydney Explorer bus and city bus service outside door. Train stops 10 mins walk. 15 mins walk to town. Eateries with different cuisines are on the doorstep or enjoy dinner with city views in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such enjoyment”
Reviews.Author: Got_Tha_Bug
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great, room was lovley and clean over looking the harbour. Service was good apart from we rang reception to make a booking at the resturant and they said the line was busy and they would call us back, but we heard nothing which was disapointing

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful--Clean--Friendly people”
Reviews.Author: sugna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bayview Hotel in Sydney, It was really first class . Beautiful view. Ate in The Sydney Oopera house and saw an opera. .. All of the Country is Beautiful. Johnnie angus

Reviews.Title: “Thick walls equals a sound sleep”
Reviews.Author: Victorianlad
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel 25 years ago, probably when it was operated under a different name - I don't recall that level of detail. The room on this stay was superior to that in which I stayed the previous night at Four Points by Sheraton Darling Harbour (Sydney). Although lighting remains less than satisfactory because it appears that many hotels (including these two mentioned) refuse to place a downlight in a central position in a hotel bedroom, nonetheless I was able to read at night while on or in bed at the Bayview Boulevard. The bathroom was adequate. One advantage of this hotel was the thick walls, explained by the age of the building - the latter may not always be a plus but I am afraid that many modern hotels have most unsatisfactory thin walls. I obtained a better rate through www.wotif.com for this hotel for a one night stay than the Sheraton to which I refer above. Staff at the Bayview were acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect day”
Reviews.Author: greatfulCentralCoast
Reviews.Content: the only down side was the small room, but the shower was brilliant, the service at the reception desk and conceige was A1, nothing was a problem or issue. Dinner at The 25th Restaurant was superb, food choice was excellent and flavours were divine, breakfast at the seasons cafe, you have to go there that was the perfect end to a very enjoyable stay in sydney. liked the location, next time we stay at bayview i would like a room with harbour view, as we had city but i am not complaining, extremely happy with all

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: RJG222
Reviews.Content: Allthough supposedly non-smoking, the room and the corridors of the floor we stayed on absolutely wreaked of cigarette smoke. Ash trays were even provided in the room. The poor sound insulation between our room and the adjoining room meant that we also had to put up with the ramblings of the two drunks next door until the early hours of the morning. Be prepared to have your car thoroughly searched before being allowed entry into the car park. Convenience to the CBD one of the few postives.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad actually”
Reviews.Author: DavidTAustralia
Reviews.Content: Bayview is a perfect mid level hotel. It is in a great location (about 5 mins walk to hyde park and 2 mins extra to george st) and if you pay a little extra to stay on the harbour side, you get a spectacular view of the city, harbour bridge and opera house from a decent, spacious room. The high rise hotel doesn't look that great from the outside but is modern and clean inside. Beds are comfortable, furnishings are modern as well(big flat screen tv) and room is very clean. Secure parking is available under the building for $25 a night. The only thing i didn't like about the room was the bathroom... it was smallish and out of proportion with the rest of the room. They also had a shower curtain which is my pet peeve with hotels. Overall however, this place passes my theory on hotels, which is ' Never stay at a hotel crappier than your house'

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Boeing767
Reviews.Content: Typically, I only stay at Hilton properties, however, this hotel was booked for me by my employer - and thus, I had no say. It is a fair distance from Circle Quay, and the main tourist areas - although the more in-shape will have no trouble walking the mile and a half or so. The rooms are VERY small, and the standard rooms look out on the William St. side. There is limited television, and no radio. HOWEVER, if your primary objective is to see the area, none of these issues is of great importance. Having said all of this, the main redeeming quality is the willingness of the front desk personnel to accommodate guest requests. If I were to return to Sydney, I would likely choose a hotel closer to the tourist attractions, however, if you have a need to be in King's Cross/Potts Point - this is a very acceptable choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and spectatcular views of Sydney”
Reviews.Author: great2smile
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with our deluxe room that was clean and nicely decorated. Great views of Sydney and just a short walk to all of the harbour attractions. I have recommended this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and close to CBD”
Reviews.Author: kooka_77
Reviews.Content: I found the service to be friendly. The location to be quite close to the CBD but without the noise as it is not located inside the CBD. The room wasn't that big but the bed was comfy. The shower head was a bit weak though, is it because of the water restriction? I was on the 9th floor but the view is only some residential buildings. At night I took a taxi back to the hotel from CBD as I didn't want to walk through Hyde park.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: supersonicsandy
Reviews.Content: The website said that there was a cafe downstairs so on the way down from the Central Coast we didn't stop for food thinking we could get a bite to eat at the cafe or restaurant. When we arrived the receptionist advised that the cafe was closed on weekends!! The sign out the front said it was only closed public holidays. I asked where we could get something to eat and she sent us down Crown street where we walked for 10mins to find nothing. Then we walked up Williams street and found nothing. Back at the hotel I discovered there was room service (wish the receptionist had have said this!!) but we were going to a wedding and it was too late to order. I thought we could just eat our mini bar food. Then discovered that they had not filled our mini bar. I rang reception and they said they would send someone to fill it. 10mins later (10mins before we had to leave) I got a phone call from reception saying that they "don't deal with mini bar" and I would have to call another number!!! Where the hell is the customer service here!!!!!! Get this, he advised that some of the standard rooms don't have mini bar!!! What a cop out! We had the menu and the racks so they just didn't fill it!!! They finally brought up some snacks just before we were leaving. I also rang the conceirge to book a taxi but the taxi never came, not sure if it was even booked. So we were late to our wedding. The room was filthy, the floor in the bathroom hadn't even been mopped as there was stuff spilt on the floor which looked like it had been there for weeks. Everything was dusty. I have worked in housekeeping in a 3 star resort which was imaculate. Everything was a disappointment, including the fact that when I checked out the girl asked if I had eaten anything from the mini bar - I said I would have if it had have been filled.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody awful”
Reviews.Author: Jenny115
Reviews.Content: Our room was not ready when we arrived, but when we got our room it stank of cigarettes. We went back to reception and asked for a new room "The hotel is booked out, sorry" well after some 'discussion' we were given another room. Well the room was a good size, but towels were as thick as paper. There was an out dated TV in the room and also no information about the hotel i.e. where was breakfast served and the facilities of the hotel. Also the check in staff had no idea what was going on in the restaurant, which was closed for Valentines Day, but was the bar open? I donâ€™t know? Well could you please find out? No! The only positive thing about the hotel was the buffet breakfast, which was excellent. How this hotel was a finalist in the best hotel in NSW is beyond me. Donâ€™t bother staying, pay a bit extra and find something more central.

Reviews.Title: “Liked Bayview For The Most Part”
Reviews.Author: JaxAnn
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were booked in a king bed standard non-smoking room. When we checked in at the front desk, they were having a hard time "finding my reservation." I booked through a travel website and not directly with the hotel but I was still annoyed when they couldn't find my reservation even with a printout of my hotel confirmation. I knew something was wrong when the woman at the front desk had to keep going to the back room to see the manager. The check in woman, Jessie Lu, was very nice and politely asked us to sit down and wait. We waited about 20 minutes and Jessie Lu was nice enough to come over and bring us our check in cards and had upgraded us to a city view room. I thought this was fair and maybe even worth the wait as our room had a great view of the city, park and the bridge. The room was clean and modern and decorated in very minimalist furniture. This was neither bad or good, just very modern. I thought the beds were comfortable although they don't give you a comforter, you only get a sheet and a thin coverlet. I don't know if that is standard and the usual in Australia. I had the same thing on my bed in Thailand. Anyhow, the room was nice with 2 sitting couch chairs and a desk, I felt like we had room for all our stuff. The bathroom was clean. The bathtub wasn't really big enough to soak and take a real comfortable bath but the shower did it's job. But the light in the bathroom had some type of fuse or electrical problem as it'd flash on and off on occasion and sometimes we would even hear noise of an electric spark. We asked for a non-smoking room which I assume is on a non-smoking floor but a handful of times, we would smell smoke in the hallway when we were leaving and coming back to our room. We assumed someone was smoking in their room that wasn't supposed too. Another guest noticed that as well. On New Year's Eve day we had to walk a few blocks to pick up a bag of ice to chill our drinks (no ice machines). When we came back in the afternoon, there was a notice from the hotel slipped under the door saying that they would bring ice to our room for a fee. If we had known about this option the night before we wouldn't have schlepped a bag of ice back to our hotel room. When we called and requested just the ice bucket, we were infromed that we would still be charged the delivery fee. So our bathroom sink made for a makeshift champagne chiller. Overall, our stay was ok because we were upgraded to a room with a view. If we didn't have that amazing view, we probably would not have enjoyed our stay as much.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are excellent”
Reviews.Author: sbond
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayview Boulevard Hotel for 2 nights in May 2008. Our accom fell through the morning of our trip and we found a room on Lastminute.com.au. The room was very modern, facing William St and had recently been renovated (end of 2007). A crib was ready in the room for our baby, and it was very comfortable. The hallways smelled of smoke, but our room didn't, and we were very happy for the discount rate. The second night my husband went to reception to request an upgrade at 5:30pm as our baby doesn't sleep well in the same room as us, and the bathroom was too small for the crib to fit. We were given a suite facing the harbour and moved immediately. My husband said I didn't want to know how much extra it was. I was disappointed that we didn't get a good rate for the upgrade, especially as the room would have been empty for the night. It would have been great customer service to have been given the upgrade for a nominal fee to cover housekeeping (maybe the full price of the room we originally stayed in). The suite was fantastic. The living area and sleeping area both had their own entrances. We were able to put our baby to sleep at 6pm in the closed off living area, and then use the sleeping area for watching TV, having dinner (table and chairs provided), using the bathroom, and one of us popping out to grab some takeaway in Darlinghurst. The views were absolutely magnificent, stretching from the city to the ocean (see my pics attached - sunrise). The hotel is a great spot; walking distance to the city, right near all the great cafes in Potts Point, 2 supermarkets, a short walk to the wharf, Hyde Park, and the great restaurants of Darlinghurst. Just avoid Kings Cross at night if you feel uncomfortable with the seedy side of Sydney. I found the car parking to be too expensive ($20+), and very difficult to get into and out of. We had a full security check every time we entered the carpark (including mirrors under the car, checking the boot of the car). Overall an excellent experience, although I wish our suite rate was discounted, and for that reason would probably stay elsewhere next time to try something new.

Reviews.Title: “Yes”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_and_Wendy
Reviews.Content: Very good location just 10 minutes walk into the city. Seamless check-in and check-out. Modern, well appointed room with great view across to harbour, bridge and opera house. Overall, everything you'd expect from a good 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel, cockroaches in our room”
Reviews.Author: grimfandango77
Reviews.Content: Fairly average hotel with a business feel to it. There's a cafe on the ground floor which sees a fair amount of business meetings, and a car park around the back (although there's plenty of parking places in the streets nearby). Busy, but competent, lobby. Rooms were comfortable and fairly modern. Clean and comfortable beds, and the bathroom had a nice shower. Unfortunately one night we had a few cockroaches in the room - on the 21st floor. When we spoke to very, very nice housekeeping personnel, they explained they'd had a roach problem and had the exterminators in! Looks like they've still got a problem. Didn't try the restaurant on the top floor as it looked overpriced and there's plenty of restaurants and bars across the road (2-min walk). In particular Bar Modena 88 (a quick google will tell you all about it) which has a wonderful atmosphere, good food and very friendly staff. Oh, 5 minutes up the road (towards Kings Cross) seemed to be an impromptu red-light district at night. Very skanky and best avoided.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: joey6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bayview Boulevard for 1 night whilst we were in Sydney. When booking we advised that the room we required was for 2 adults and 2 children, after checking in we went to our room only to find twin single beds. We returned to reception where the problem was quickly rectified. The hotel was clean tidy and furnished to a high standard, overall a great hotel. We had dinner at the nearby Italian restaurant Spigolos, it was saturday evening and they had entertainment on which made a great atmosphere and the food was lovely and not expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TraceyT5445
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week for work. Didn't have much time to explore the hotel but check-in was fine and weren't any dramas. My room was on the 17th floor with city views. Overall the room was decorated nicely - modern, clean and comfortable. The bathroom was large and clean with lots of nice toiletries and towels. I also ordered room service a few nights while I was there and the food arrived quick, correct and hot. It is fairly expensive but I wasn't surprised at this because it's room service! The menu is extensive though which is good and it's 24 hours a day! I loved my stay here and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is pathetic, don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: StellyandDave
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on one of the busy weekends in sydney, the room had a "city view" well this was true however its only the case if you look with your face pressed against the glass of your window which doesn't open, and then you can only see two towers of the city. When we arrived at 5pm we were told our room was not ready!!!! after traveling you don't expect to arrive 3 hours after the earlieast check in time to be told you'll have to sit and wait in reception, not an offer of a drink, something to eat or anything. When they eventually sorted a room out for us we were given a disabled room. this i'm sure would be fine if you needed these facilities, however in the bathroom we had nowhere to put anything, and the sinks were very low. We were not asked if we were ok having this room. when i went to complain at reception i was greeted by the standard apology and blank looks from the receptionist. she said she would have to talk to the manager, of course she never did, and nobody cared because they had our money, says it all! the room itself was ok, the standards were good, room average size, the water in the bathroom was cold, which seemed like its a standard problem as the comment card in the room had been filled in by a previous guest. hotel has a good location, close enough to walk to everything, but with so much choice i wouldn't bother, as if you have a problem they simply don't care.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel, Recently Renovated”
Reviews.Author: Vancouver_Blue
Reviews.Content: After several days at the Boulevard I think I must say that my experience was just as favourable as on my previous visits to this hotel. My room had been recently renovated. Although renovations were mentioned on one web site , there was absolutely no sign of any work in progress in the hotel that I saw. The staff at reception were friendly, the room was quiet for sleeping during the day and had a wonderful harbour view although I had booked a less expensive city view room. I particularly enjoy the 10 - 15 minute walk into the city across Hyde Park from this hotel and will look no further on any future vistis to Sydney.

Reviews.Title: “Chaos with bookings!!!”
Reviews.Author: dalton1skiing
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for only one night for a friends Hens party. 3 rooms had been booked more than a month in advance and interconnecting rooms were specified. On arrival we were given 3 rooms on 3 different floors. 2 double beds in each room was also specified, but only 1 room was correct. The other 2 had only 1 double bed each. The problems took over an hour to recify, yet, we still ended up with all rooms being on different floors. We had to make 4 room changes just to get the correct amount of beds for what had been booked & paid for. Reception sent us to several rooms, to then discover only a single or double bed in there. Do they not have a list that says how many beds are in each room? Reception staff seemed unhelpful and didnt seem to understand the stress they had caused for everyone. We were unable to all sit in the one room prior to the night out, this being the reason interconnecting rooms was booked. No apology was given nor concern for the fact that sorting the rooms out had made us late for the dinner booked. To access the lift and rooms requires a swipe card. Twice we were given cards that didnt work. They were also only able to give us 2 per room, despite 3 people being booked for each room. This caused further inconvenience as people arrived back at different times and had to wake friends to come down to reception to let them in the lift and room. The hotel was very clean. Rooms were on the small size, but some had excellent views of the harbour or city. Parking is available underneath the hotel for $20 per night. We didnt eat there or use the pool/gym etc. I would stay again if I only required one room, but wouldnt trust that they could handle a multiple booking, or any room requests.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Drew F
Reviews.Content: Although renovations are still being done, you would never notice besides the faint paint smell in the lobby. I booked a one bedroom which included parking and buffet breakfast and absolutely loved the stay. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The room was very clean and tidy. The parking was convenient, being located under the hotel as opposed to next door or up the street as you get with some Sydney hotels. Breakfast had a wide variety of choices and we were quickly seated and offered coffee and tea. The view from the room overlooked buildings, however it was still a great view. I would gladly stay here again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Dudley93
Reviews.Content: I booked via the internet and when we arrived were given a smoking room on a smoking floor. I asked for a non-smoking room on a non-smoking floor and was quickly assisted into a room on a higher floor. The staff were unfailingly helpful and pleasant. The view from the window towards the Sydney Skyline, the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the Harbour was wonderful. The hotel is very well situated, quiet and well worth the stay. I cannot understand the negative reviews on this site. I have stayed all over the world and this was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location!”
Reviews.Author: lissatru
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Bayview Boulevard for a short 4 day break and really enjoyed the experience. The hotel is located on Williams St in between Kings Cross and the city and it only took max 10mins to walk into the city and about a 5min walk to Kings Cross (although not worth going to). Kings Cross is so sleazy and I felt unsafe walking up and down the street. There is still construction going on downstairs and as we were on the 16th floor we never heard any noise but trying to check-in was very annoying as the noise was unbearable and they didn't have enough staff on during the check-in period. We stayed in a harbour view room which has been refurnished which is very nice. The views were awesome, we could see the harbour bridge and the opera house as well as the city skyline. We had a package that included a buffet breakfast each morning which was fantastic, very well presented and the staff were very eager and friendly. Overall, we loved our stay at the Bayview Boulevard and would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Ageing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mainze
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a pleasant enough place, it just seemed dated now. The top floor restaurant had a 70's feel about it, it has great views of the city though despite the decor. It is a 15-20 walk into the city centre, so it's also a little out of the way from all the major attractions. We had a very dated room, it was clean however and the facilities were good. The staff seemed pleasant enough at all times and the food and service was generally good. It is my understanding though that it is currently being re-furbished floor by floor so it may well be worth a look in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hollysaysboo
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Boulevard as part of a round the world trip last year and it was so awful we did everything we could to be moved to another hotel but unfortunately, it was new year and everything was booked. The lift had a mind of its own and took you to the floor it wanted rather than the floor you were staying on, the money exchange rate was exorbitant and the windows in the room were filthy and wouldn't open. Although we had (foolishly) asked for a smoking room, we didn't expect it to be stink to high heaven. The rooms were dated (although clean). The highlight for us was the promotional video that played on the in-room TV's - absolutely hilarious and looked nothing like the hotel we were staying in! Avoid this hotel at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Its Okay”
Reviews.Author: Vinzeph
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in good location and is within walking distance of major attractions in Sydney and there is a nearby train station at Hyde Park. Though a bit dated, the rooms are adequate and comfortable. Staff are okay... not rude to say the least. Overall, you got what you paid for. If you are looking for a basic, clean and comforatble mid-priced hotel and want to stretch your budget, then I think this hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Sydney Boulevard Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: victorjohn
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed my recent stay at The Sydney Boulevard. Upon check in I was given a city view room on the 23rd floor of the hotel and found that the room was extremely spacious and modern. The bathroom was marble lined and had very good shower and water pressure. Very nice toiletries provided. The queen size bed(two in room) was very comfortable and the room was very quite. No traffic noise or noise from other rooms which made for a good nights sleep. Very good air conditioning units and it was easy to adjust the temperature of the room according to requirements. Just a few minutes walk to Sydney CBD and buses passed the door quite frequently. All in all a lovely hotel, and the tarriff is quite reasonable. John Melbourne Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: tattyead
Reviews.Content: Great location giving 10 minute walks to the cross, Oxford street or Wooloomooloo - walk to the city or train from Kings Cross. Try Stanley Street across the road for some decent restaurants. Rooms are adequate and the hotel is very quiet. Great views towards the Bridge and Opera House. Worth the money but dont expect the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: dbasha
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Boulevard for 3 nights last year. The hotel is very average, and is perhaps only worth it if you get a good deal on the price. The location is generally good (a 10 to 20 minute walk should get you to most of the main tourist areas), although it can get a bit dicey after dark!
