Reviews.Title: “4 Stars??? i dont think so...”
Reviews.Author: Cordial321
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was below average. we asked for towels in the morning only to be given one. i had to call house keeping again to ask for another one, and the lady hung up on me before i finished talking. The restaurant closes on sundays and closed the next day due to anzac day. unfortunately, we were not informed about this until sunday night which meant that we would not be able to dine there which was very disappointing (we were leaving sydney on monday night). we ended up ordering room service and had a lasagna which looked and tasted like the microwaved ones you buy at the super market. at AU$16 it was extremely overpriced. finally after much disappointment i decided to take a bath - except there was no plug available. On a good note, when i let the duty manager know about my disappointment, we were given a complimentary bottle of chardonay. it was a nice gesture but overall the hotel was disappointing and not worth its 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, poor service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Although I booked the rooms months in advance, I did not get what I was promised. I specifically asked for 2 beds in the room and upon arrival was only given one. I had to sleep on a fold out bed, which took three hours to reach the room. 25th floor dining area is highly promoted but but was closed on my visit, even though it was easter and the hotel was full. Woken by house keeping at 7am on Sunday morning. The hotel in general seemed disorganised and incompetent.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star it aint!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is advertised at 4-4.5 star - in what universe?! It's really just a step up from a motel. Our 'deluxe' room included - a broken phone, a faulty remote, 2 blown light globes, no hand soap until the third day, an ill-fitting toilet seat and complimentary newspapers that never showed up. The 'Bayview Brasserie' has a view of the undercover carpark driveway and the buffet breakfast is almost as bleak. The only good thing about this place is the view - we did have a great view of the Harbour Bridge from our room on the 12th floor, and the view from the 25th floor bar is pretty impressive. And some of the staff were sweet. But for all the grief, I don't think it was worth it. If this hotel doesn't lift its game, then it should be advertised appropriately as 2.5 stars - 4 is just plain false advertising.

Reviews.Title: “The Boulevard came up trumps”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Boulevard for 4 nights in December 2004. As a family of 4 (including kids aged 6 and 9) travelling in Australia 'on a budget', we were looking for clean, affordable accomodation close to the centre of the city. The Boulevard fitted the bill perfectly. We had a family room, which comprised 2 double beds, and this was more than adequate for our needs. Our rate of AUD$175 per night included breakfast and represented very good value for money. Although we had a city view room, go for the slightly more expensive harbour view. Whilst not right next to the water, the view is still impressive. The hotel is no more than 15 minutes easy walk from the centre of town, and is close to a very good public swimming pool, and also a stones throw from The Hard Rock Cafe. Both ideal for the kids! We can sincerely recommend the hotel and will certainly consider staying there again when we next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Noting fancy”
Reviews.Author: rali
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations of this hotel, based on their website and brochures and was somewhat disappointed. The hotel is very outdated, you have to pay $10 extra to use the gym, the location is a bit out of the way and overall it is not worth the price. The staff was OK, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: fl-resident
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sydney Boulevard from June 16th - 20th, 2004. We found the hotel staff to be very helpful and friendly, especially the concierge staff. They were very informative about the city transit services, shopping and attractions. The room was nice but one day we had to request maid service after we returned late afternoon to our room and discovered that the maid had not been there all day. One phone call to guest services and the situation was taken care of. This was a very nice hotel but we wish it had been a little closer to the harbors. The city transport was dependable so we didn't have to walk as much in order to get to the shopping and attractions that interested us. I would recommend this hotel to others who aren't interested in the harbor attractions.

HotelInfo.Name: Bayview Boulevard Sydney
HotelInfo.Address: 90 William Street, Sydney, New South Wales 2011, Australia (Formerly The Sydney Boulevard)
